text:
Does anyone know when the call for Associations V4 changed from:
 PUT /crm/v4/objects/{association.FromObject}/{fromItemId}/associations/{association.ToObject}/{toItemId}
To:
 PUT /crm/v4/objects/{association.FromObject}/{fromItemId}/associations/*default*/{association.ToObject}/{toItemId}?

Noticed over the last couple of days that the call was failing. Worked out why this morning.

It is written up in with default in the documentation, but it wasn't some time ago, when I wrote my code library.  I have not seen any documentation stating a change was coming.

(haven't read all comments, perhaps already on here)
 *Use-case:* using AI tool to automate support. If it can it just responds to the user, but sometimes it would be helpful to
1.  <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/API-Assign-a-conversation-to-a-user/idi-p/811531|Assign the conversation to a user>
2. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Tag-a-person-in-a-conversation-comment/td-p/810950|Tag user in convo comments> 
3. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Live-conversations-get-customer-s-location/idi-p/941565|Get customer location from Live-Chat>
I had to reverse engineer yalls private mobile app API to support both of these, <https://github.com/Erol444/HubSpot-api|see here>. There are also some docs wrong that I reported (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Incorrect-docs-Conversation-sort-threads/td-p/938929|convertaion sort>, <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Incorrect-docs-get-conversation-threads/td-p/938731|thread status filter>). cc <@U04B32JHTUZ>
Hahaha I love the liability clause
idk, haven't read ToS, better be safe than sorry:)
Still a fun solution and Iâ€™ve done the same thing before. :saluting_face:
Hi. I had also issues with that Endpoint yesterday. I had to add the labels within the Body of the Request. After it did work again.

I am trying to get the list of contacts who filled out the meeting form (the one with the calendar that can be linked to Google Calendar). `<https://api.hubapi.com/marketing/v3/forms/>` doesn't work.

Is there a search endpoint that I could use where I would just use the form ID, the scheduling link or any identifiers that would list out the list of contacts that filled out that particular form?

The best solution I could think of right now is use the list endpoint `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/lists/{listId}>`. Basically I would just predefine it in HubSpot than fetch it right there. I have not explored this yet. But I'm trying to not build another component inside HubSpot just so I can have my app to work.

Is there anyone familiar with the EVENTS API? The documentation mentions support for `sorts=["DESCENDING"]` but I am getting the following error message.

```HTTP response body: {"status":"error","message":"Only a single sort field 'occurredAt' is supported","correlationId":"e958ed2f-a777-4bc1-b1cd-c0d33046c6d5","category":"VALIDATION_ERROR"}```

```import HubSpot
from pprint import pprint
from HubSpot.events import ApiException

client = HubSpot.Client.create(access_token="")

try:
    api_response = client.events.events_api.get_page(limit=1, 
                                                     object_type="company", 
                                                     event_type="{EVENT TYPE}", 
                                                     object_id="{COMPANY OBJECT ID}",
                                                     sort=["DESCENDING"])
    pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
    print("Exception when calling events_api->get_page: %s\n" % e)```

Dan, check out these two links:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/library/meetings>

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/get-submissions-for-a-form>

I feel like this is a dumb question, especially for my first here...I'll provide a little background but we're updating contacts in HubSpot with data from our product portal via the API on a schedule. This has been operating just fine for months now. We ID'd a new piece of data we need in HS so I created the property and provided to the data ops team to send over as part of the regularly scheduled programming.

Here's the issue, only the new property isn't getting written. All the other properties we're sending to HS continue to get updated, but just this new property is not being populated from the API call. And I'm not seeing any errors on this

Is there a limit to the number of properties can be updated on a contact in a batch? I'm open to any ideas as to what the issue could be. I've asked the data ops team for example body and can provide that as soon as I get it, but kind of at a loss at the moment.
